pullRequest.body:
This contains a port of @b-mehta's https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/commits/irrational-pi branch, with the conversion to Lean 4 performed by @b-mehta with his google hat on.

My contributions here are minimal! 

Co-authored-by: Bhavik Mehta <bhavikmehta8@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Bhavik Mehta <bhavikmehta@google.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b3fc1a56bf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17103/commits/b3fc1a56bf3569298a059ba5c8261c9e67ded27c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.Real.Pi.Irrational`|1892|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ integral_pos`
`+ irrational_pi`
`+ natDegree_ofNat`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
bot fix style

Question, is this Niven's proof? If so, then that reference should be in the docstring. But also, I'm having a difficult time matching notions between the article and this file. Is this the 1947 article?

This proof idea came from Question 10 here: https://www.dpmms.cam.ac.uk/study/IA/AnalysisI/2016-2017/sheet4.pdf. It is essentially the same as this one: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proof_that_%CF%80_is_irrational#Cartwright's_proof.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11124240360/job/30909370203)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11124240360/job/30909370634)
Two comments with golfing suggestions.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Two comments with golfing suggestions.

Please expand the module docstring a bit, as requested.

E.g. the link to wiki mentioned above should be recorded, I think.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
```
This feels useful enough to be somewhere else.
I think I'd make a slightly different claim, that this is useful enough that we probably already have the result somewhere else.

I just looked again and I can't find anything quite right - `irrational_iff_ne_rational` is probably the one you expected to exist, but that's not close enough here because I want a positive natural denominator.

Okay thinking about it a bit more, I'm not sure this is actually that useful - the existential can just be satisfied with `q.num` and `q.den`. The way I use it is to hide the fact that we actually know what `a` and `b` are, for readability's sake
Can this docstring explain the main proof ideas?
I added some more detail to the docstring.
Can `fun_prop` solve some of these? (Sorry, can't check myself right now - my internet connection is bad.)
Yes!

I'm not sure if fun_prop is meant to solve these already, or that was just an in-progress PR...

But at least, can you move the x into the `have`, to avoid the first `intro x` line? The same applies for a few more have's below.
Thanks, I've cleaned up the `intro`s
Why does this name start with `my`?

it's a private lemma, so I just gave it a convenient name! But more realistically, the point of this lemma is to be a particular variant of `tendsto_pow_div_factorial_atTop` which is most useful for this application
I would still prefer `aux` or `tmp` over `my`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `Irrational `
